[[File:The Reeve's Tale (J.R.R. Tolkien).jpg|thumb|250px|''The Reeve's Tale: Version Prepared for Recitation at the 'Summer Diversions' '']]
'''''The Reeve's Tale: Version Prepared for Recitation at the 'Summer Diversions' ''''' is [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s version of [[wikipedia:Geoffrey Chaucer|Chaucer]]'s [[wikipedia:The Reeve's Tale|''Reeve's Tale'']], it was privately printed as pamphlets in [[1939]] in Oxford.

It contains a two-page introduction, and a reworked text of ''The Reeve's Tale'' by Chaucer.

The text was reprinted in [[2008]] in ''[[Tolkien Studies 5]]''.

It was again reprinted in [[2024]] in ''[[Tolkien on Chaucer, 1913-1959]]'', but here it incorporates some lately discovered materials, including restored lines that were omitted previously, a list of footnote-glossary, and a text 'Chaucerian grammar' lasting several pages.
